page.title: 11Tolney Lane, Newark
page.content: Tolney Lane is long and open with two caravan sites. There are some old derelict railway carriages and some houses. There is a scrapyard and a knackers yard on the same piece of land. The knackers yard breeds maggots for anglers. At the fork of the road is a cottage where an old man lives. On the right fork is a large building called Millhouse. On it are printed the words "Davey's Noted Ales, Offices and Brewery, Barnbygate, Newark. Tolney Lane is classed as a rough area but it is quite industrious. Gypsies are the local residents. who live in caravans on 3 different sites amongst the untidy greenery. There are no shops but the Lane is close to the town.
